intro: Calonyction speciosum var. muricatum, commonly known as the passionflower, is a tropical vine characterized by its striking, complex flowers. The plant features showy, five-lobed petals that are often adorned with a distinctive crown of stamens. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. The vine produces edible berries that are rich in nutrients and commonly consumed in various cuisines. It is native to the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates.
